result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Susan B Carlson

records.addlTxt:
9:01 AM Defendant Susan B Carlson in court.  Attorney Damon Paul Stichert in court for Susan B Carlson.  Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
The parties are requesting another 60 days for a status. Court grants
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:02 AM Defendant Susan B Carlson in court.  Attorney Damon Paul Stichert in court for Susan B Carlson.  Attorney Daniel McGrath in court for State of Wisconsin. Judge orders to use the DAR.
Not guilty pleas are entered. This matter will be set for a status conference. Bond is continued.
Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:03 AM Defendant Susan B Carlson in court.  Attorney Damon Paul Stichert in court for Susan B Carlson.  Attorney Daniel McGrath in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Special Agent Simon is sworn in and testifies. Testifies to being a Special Agent with the Department of Justice Criminal Investigation. Testifies to Special Agent Loreen Glaman being the initial agent on this case. Testifies to reviewing Glaman's report. Witness identifies the defendant in court, court recognizes. Testifies to the defendants previous job title. Testifies to her job duties. Testifies to details of what she was supposed to do with the funds received to the office. Testifies to funds that were missing and not turned over to the city finance department. Testifies to the three methods they used to determine the funds were missing. Testifies to the funds missing from 2015 - 2020. Testifies to the missing funds all being cash payments. Testifies to the statement made by the defendant regarding her and her husbands incomes. Testifies to Special Agent Glaman getting statements from the defendants bank accounts. Testifies to the money that was not accounted for in the defendant's bank account. 

Attorney Stichert cross examines the witness. Witness testifies to the finance department not mentioning any concerns of the payments coming in. Witness testifies to the clerk that started asking questions after reviewing previous payment records. Testifies to the program used to identify the funds. Testifies to the defendant using Microsoft word to document payments when the usual program was not working. Testifies to not being sure of everything Agent Glaman reviewed. Testifies to Agent Glaman interviewing the defendant. Testifies to the statements made by the defendant to Agent Glaman during the interview. Testifies to cash withdrawals that came from the bank account the her paychecks were deposited. Testifies to another account with unaccounted funds but doesn't recall who's name is on that account. Testifies to the transactions that accumulated to the unaccounted funds. 

Attorney McGrath follows up with questions for the witness. Witness testifies to the defendant never mentioning any family member putting money into her account.

Attorney Stichert questions the witness.

Court finds probable cause to believe a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. 
Bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on May 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:13 AM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Susan B Carlson appeared in court, Attorney Damon Paul Stichert for Susan B Carlson appeared in court.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved
